channel.title: Tutorial
channel.description:
Hey, I run a server and I want to know how to make a tutorial kind of like PwnScape's tutorial for new people, could someone help me do that?
P.S. I run a 317 server

item.title: Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @kilop kilop
item.description:
@kilop wrote:

Sorry about this but, I mean like when brand new players login, there is a tutorial guy sitting there, like to help them and they talk to him and he tells you about server when you have to click this “Click here to continue” so you can read more information. And you can choose options, and if you could help me, I want a player to choose from 3 options and he gets items after a certain option he chooses.

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

I think I know what you want, one second. Will post with a short tut

Add this with all your Public Voids

 public void MainHelpMenu() {
 sendQuest("", 8144);  //Title
 clearQuestInterface();
 sendQuest("", 8145);
 sendQuest("", 8147);
 sendQuest("", 8148);
 sendQuest("", 8149);
 sendQuest("", 8150);
 sendQuest("", 8151);
 sendQuestSomething(8143);
 showInterface(8134);
 flushOutStream();
 }

Then search this

public void initialize() {

replace that with this

	public void initialize() {
	MainHelpMenu();

Save compile and that should do that, it will pop up with that interface when you log on.

Read full topic

item.title: Tutorial
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

like ::help?

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("help") && (playerRights >= 0)) {
				String name = command.substring(5);
				        sendQuest("", 8144);  //Title
					sendQuest("", 8145);
					clearQuestInterface();
		sendQuest("", 8147);
		sendQuest("", 8148);
		sendQuest("", 8149);
		sendQuest("", 8150);
		sendQuest("", 8151);
		sendQuest("", 8152);
		sendQuest("", 8153);		
                sendQuest("", 8154);
		sendQuest("", 8155);
		sendQuest("", 8156);
		sendQuest("", 8157);
		sendQuest("", 8158);
					sendQuestSomething(8143);
					showInterface(8134);
					flushOutStream();
}

In-Between all the “” add your text
